docs.text: Class: Derivatization A technique used in chemistry which transforms a chemical compound into a product of similar chemical structure, called a derivative. The derivative has properties more amenable to some particular analytical method. A unique identifier for a thing NamedThing name 0..1 String A human-readable name for a thing NamedThing description 0..1 String A human-readable description for a thing NamedThing type 1..1 Uriorcurie The type of a thing NamedThing category 1..1 GeneralCategories NamedThing Comments Some samples analyzed by GC require derivatization in order to make them suitable for analysis. Compounds that have poor volatility, poor thermal stability, or that can be adsorbed in the injector will exhibit non-reproducible peak areas, heights, and shapes. Other compounds that respond poorly on a specific detector may need to be “tagged” with a different functional group to improve detection. docs.text: Some samples analyzed by GC require derivatization in order to make them suitable for analysis. Compounds that have poor volatility, poor thermal stability, or that can be adsorbed in the injector will exhibit non-reproducible peak areas, heights, and shapes. Other compounds that respond poorly on a specific detector may need to be “tagged” with a different functional group to improve detection.

docs.text: name: Derivatization description: A technique used in chemistry which transforms a chemical compound into a product of similar chemical structure, called a derivative. The derivative has properties more amenable to some particular analytical method. comments: - Some samples analyzed by GC require derivatization in order to make them suitable for analysis. Compounds that have poor volatility, poor thermal stability, or that can be adsorbed in the injector will exhibit non-reproducible peak areas, heights, and shapes. Other compounds that respond poorly on a specific detector may need to be “tagged” with a different functional group to improve detection. from_schema: https://w3id.org/microbiomedata/monterey-schema is_a: MaterialProcessing slots: - derivatization_agent - duration - speed - temp_c

docs.text: name: Derivatization description: A technique used in chemistry which transforms a chemical compound into a product of similar chemical structure, called a derivative. The derivative has properties more amenable to some particular analytical method. comments: - Some samples analyzed by GC require derivatization in order to make them suitable for analysis. Compounds that have poor volatility, poor thermal stability, or that can be adsorbed in the injector will exhibit non-reproducible peak areas, heights, and shapes. Other compounds that respond poorly on a specific detector may need to be “tagged” with a different functional group to improve detection. from_schema: https://w3id.org/microbiomedata/monterey-schema is_a: MaterialProcessing attributes: derivatization_agent: name: derivatization_agent description: A chemical entity which is used in a derivatization process to add chemical groups to a molecule in an attempt to make it more suitable for analyses like GC-MS. from_schema: https://w3id.org/microbiomedata/monterey-schema rank: 1000 alias: derivatization_agent owner: Derivatization domain_of: - Derivatization range: DerivatizationAgents duration: name: duration description: a period or interval of time examples: - value: '{ has_numeric_value: 2, has_unit: hours }' from_schema: https://w3id.org/microbiomedata/monterey-schema rank: 1000 domain: PlannedProcess alias: duration owner: Derivatization domain_of: - PlannedProcess - Suspending - Derivatization slot_group: structured_measurements range: QuantityValue speed: name: speed description: A rate of change, such as a number of miles traveled per hour or a number of rotations in one minute todos: - these descriptions have to be generic enough that other classes can use them - classes can customize many of a slot's attributes though slot_usage... but stay monotonic! from_schema: https://w3id.org/microbiomedata/monterey-schema rank: 1000 domain: PlannedProcess alias: speed owner: Derivatization domain_of: -
